intro: Chaenostoma divaricatum, commonly known as the variable water-starwort, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It is a member of the Araliaceae family and typically grows in wetland habitats such as marshes and along the edges of ponds. The plant features finely divided, feather-like leaves that are often submerged or floating, and it produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters. Its root system is adapted for aquatic environments, and it plays a role in stabilizing wetland soils. Chaenostoma divaricatum is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to thrive in nutrient-rich waters.
